Header: ICC President Mustafa Kamal resigns from post
Content: International Cricket Council President, Mustafa Kamal has resigned from his post on Wednesday April 1, Kamal announced his resignation, accusing colleagues within the games global body of acting ”Unlawfully”. Even since Bangladesh lost to India in the 2015 World Cup quarterfinals, Kamal was upset after a controversial no-ball incident that allowed Rohit Sharma to score a decisive century. He openly alleged the ICC of favouring with India. Following that Kamal was told he wouldn’t be able to give out the World Cup trophy. He protested that the decision went against his right as ICC president but to no avail. As per convention, it is the president who hands over the trophy to the winning captain.
